pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Godot is a IDE for building video games capable of making 3D and 2D games in a day. It can produce games for desktop, mobile, VR (virtual reality), AR (augmented reality), web browser games, multiplayer games for many game genres.
It also has available game AI algorithms, physics engines, level generators.
It also supports C/C++, C# 7.0, visual programming similar to UDK, GDScript similar to Python. It has a built in 3D level editor, IDE object manager.
ABIs are limited so that the main editor program is a native CHOST build and export templates produce the game in the CTARGET ABI/platform of choice.
ABIs of various components: Editor - CHOST native ABI Dedicated server - 32 or 64 bit CHOST ABI Headless server - 32 or 64 bit CHOST ABI
The ebuild produces the export templates for exporting to CTARGET: Android - armv6 [in 2.1 slot only], armv7, arm64v8, x86, x86_64 ABIs Linux - 32 bit or 64 bit CHOST ABI(s) Web - Asm.js [in 2.1 slot only], WASM [in 3.1 slot only],
For Android support: ANDROID_NDK_ROOT must be set as a per-package environmental variable. EGODOT_ANDROID_ARCHES must be set a per-package environmental variable and must include arm64v8. Support for android arch for the corresponding version are 2.x: armv6, armv7, arm64v8, x86, x86_64. 3.x: armv7, arm64v8, x86, x86_64
The ebuild allows to fine tune or shrink the internal dependencies of the export template as a per-package environmental variable. These clear the USE flags config options. Only web and android env vars are offered. Options must be space separated.
Examples: Contents of /etc/portage/env/godot.conf: EGODOT_ANDROID_ARCHES="x86 x86_64 armv7 arm64v8" EGODOT_ANDROID_CONFIG="module_opensimplex_enabled=True" EGODOT_WEB_CONFIG="module_opensimplex_enabled=True"
Contents of /etc/portage/package.env: dev-games/godot godot.conf
